article:
The 1987â88 Football League Cup, known as the Littlewoods Cup for sponsorship
reasons, was the 28th season of the Football League Cup, a knockout competition
for England's top 92 football clubs.

The competition began on 17 August 1987, and ended with the final on 24 April
1988 at the Wembley Stadium. The final was played between Luton Town and
Arsenal. The match, played in front of 95,732 spectators at Wembley Stadium, was
won by Luton Town by 3–2.
